abstract.para: To get technical support and product updates, you need to register and activate &productname; with the &scc;. It is recommended to register during the installation, since this will enable you to install the system with the latest updates and patches available. However, if you are offline or want to skip the registration step, you can register at any time later from the installed system.
In case your organization provides a local registration server (&susemgr; or ⪪), register with the local server rather than with the &scc;. Contact your internal IT for help.

note.title: &suse; Account
note.para: Registering with the &scc; requires a SUSE account. In case you do not have a SUSE account yet, go to the &scc; home page () to create one.

sect1.title: Registering During the Installation
sect1.para: The easiest and recommended way to register is to do it during the installation. It will not only allow you to install the latest patch level of &productname;, but you will also get access to all modules and extensions without having to provide an additional installation media. THis also applies to all modules or extension you install. For details on the registration process refer to .

If the system was successfully registered during installation, YaST will add online repositories provided by &scc;. This prevents problems if local installation sources are no longer available and ensures that you always get the latest updates from the online repositories.

sect1.title: Registering during Automated Deployment
sect1.para: If you deploy your instances automatically using &ay;, you can register the system during the installation by providing the respective information in the &ay; control file. Refer to for details.

sect1.title: Registering from the Installed System
sect1.para: If you have skipped the registration during the installation or want to re-register your system, you can do so at any time using the YaST module Product Registration or the command line tool SUSEConnect.

sect2.title: Registering with YaST
sect2.para: To register the system start YaST Software Product Registation. Provide the E-mail address associated with the &suse; account you or your organization uses to manage subscriptions.
Enter the Registration Code you received with your copy of &productname;. Proceed with Next to start the registration process.

By default the system is registered with the &scc;. However, if your organization provides local regsitration servers you can either choose one form the list of auto-detected servers or provide the URl at Register System via local SMT Server. Proceed with Next to finish the registration.

sect2.para: To register from the command line, use the command

Replace REGISTRATION_CODE with the registration code you received with your copy of &productname;. Replace EMAIL_ADDRESS with the E-mail address associated with the &suse; account you or your organization uses to manage subscriptions.
This SUSEconnect command will only register the base system of &productname;. This is required to register other system components as described in .

sect3.title: Registering Extensions
sect3.para: Once you have regsitered the base system, you also need to register all modules and extensions you have installed.
